en: Creates an explosion when an enemy dies.
Frankly a misuse of the tool, but if they didn't want it to be a bomb they shouldn't have given it that name.
Fires a spread of low damaging fruity bullets every third attack.
A good soldier can turn anything into a weapon, and makes a nasty adversary at a cafeteria food fight.
Summons a protective shield that spins around you and can slam into enemies.
Generally considered a weak weapon in any situation involving bugs.
Explodes whenever you take damage, knocking foes away.
Note: Do not go out of way to activate! Is very uncomfortable. Frankly how it manages to devastate the enemies but not hurt me is beyond my understanding.
Gain a temporary 30% speed boost when you kill an enemy.
It's engravings showcase, specifically, a bird. Probably a hawk or eagle or something. Definitely NOT a snail. Frankly I'm not sure how one could confuse it as such.
Groovy! Oh yeah this lets you dash more frequently I think.

[fade start=40 length=200]Characterized by thin roof pillars, fastback styling and implied aerodynamics, it symbolized 1960s Jet Age design. The '60 and '61 Models shared their roof lines and chassis, with the 1961 Model featuring substantially revised front and rear styling.[/fade]
Creates gravity wells that trap enemies temporarily.
This gauntlet, created by Sir Gravity himself, harnesses the power of Magnetism to capture foes.
Grants a temporary damage boost after you kill an enemy.
Don't worry! You're not actually taking their souls, they [size=14]Probably...[/size] dont have any!
I'm glad I'm not a vegan
Applies burn damage to the target
In 7th grade I accidentally created a fire in the microwave. I don't think I used one again for years.
Pay attention on the road. Pay attention on the road. Pay attention on the road. Pay attention on the road.
The lens doesn't work but I still feel more accurate!
Thunderstorms have always felt calming. A little risk of rain can be quite thrilling, and knowing I'm safe in my house is oh so satisfying.
[color=red]Halves your firerate[/color] and triples your damage.
Increases your damage by your speed.
Increases your damage, firerate, [color=orange]crit[/color] chance, [color=orange]crit[/color] damage, and dash cooldown.
Nice comfort. Always available in my house. Really easy to buy a bunch and to just have in a bag.
Sometimes drains health from slain enemies. Activates more often in close proximity with targets.
Still has the terrible smell of Leechbert. Alluring.
Grants an additional option when opening a chest.
I'M A PIRATE MANNNNNNNN!! I'M LIKE THE FREAKING PIRATES OF THE CARIBEAN WOOOOOO
Shows the rarity of the items in chests. [color=red]WARNING: inaccurate[/color]
Grants the player luck in the new year!
This year, my resolutions will definitely succeed.
Pizza is by far hands down the best food ever created by far.
Boosts random Items, shifts over time.
Leaves a lingering fire in the area of your [color=green]secondary[/color] ability.
The non-copyrightable weapon of the characters in my favorite movie, Space Battle: The Organization Fights Again.
Okay, they're not that cold, but I probably want to put them in the microwave first.
As far as stupid things you can do on the way to the military, this has gotta be a lot stupider than what I did.
Gives a 10% chance to gain a key when you are hit. Gain 1% [color=cyan]defense[/color].
Honestly probably hurts more than it helps, but at least it looks nice?
Doubles your movement speed [color=red]and dash cooldown[/color].
Replaces your primary attack with a [color=red]lower damage[/color] homing attack.
Give up trying to understand it.
[color=red]Replaces your secondary attack with a great ability ;)[/color]
Are burgers healthy? Well, I hope they are, since that's the only leftovers in the fridge.
